KPK Sebut Rencana Jokowi Tunjuk Dewan Pengawas Bentuk Pelemahan
02 Nov 2019, 23:47 by M Rosseno Aji, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) menyebut keberadaan dewan pengawas merupakan salah satu bentuk pelemahan terhadap lembaga antikorupsi ini.
Juru bicara KPK Febri Diansyah mengatakan tak mempermasalahkan penunjukan langsung anggota Dewan Pengawas oleh Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi. Sebab, kata dia, hal tersebut sudah sesuai dengan Undang-unang Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 tentang Komisi Pemberantasan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (UU KPK).
"Persoalan bukan pada kriteria, tapi ada beberapa problem di UU tersebut yang berisiko pelemahan," kata dia, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Febri mengatakan KPK telah menganalisa UU hasil revisi. Hasilnya ditemukan ada 26 poin perubahan yang berpotensi melemahkan KPK. Salah satu hal yang dianggap melemahkan KPK yakni keberadaan Dewan Pengawas itu sendiri.
Tim transisi KPK yang melakukan penelaahan terhadap UU baru menyebutkan Dewan Pengawas lebih berkuasa daripada Pimpinan KPK, namun syarat menjadi Pimpinan KPK lebih berat dibanding Dewan Pengawas.
Pimpinan KPK diharuskan, berijazah sarjana hukum atau sarjana lain yang memiliki keahlian dan pengalaman paling sedikit 15 tahun dalam bidang hukum, ekonomi, keuangan atau perbankan. Syarat itu tak ada untuk dewan pengawas.
Selain itu, kewenangan dewan juga masuk pada teknis penanganan perkara. Mereka berwenang memberikan izin tertulis untuk penyadapan, penggeledahan, hingga penyitaan.
Integritas Dewan Pengawas juga hal lain yang disorot tim transisi. Tidak seperti pimpinan KPK, anggota dewan pengawas tidak dilarang untuk bertemu dengan pihak-pihak yang tengah berperkara di KPK. Hal ini menurut tim berpotensi menimbulkan konflik kepentingan.
Febri mengatakan KPK tak berwenang menentukan kriteria dan syarat seorang dewan pengawas. Sebab, kedua hal itu sudah diatur oleh UU. "Kalau kriterianya apa, syarat-syaratnya apa, situ sudah diatur undang-undang," ujar Febri.

KPK Mention Jokowi's Plan Appoints Supervisory Board to Form Weakening
02 Nov 2019, 23:47 by M Rosseno Aji, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) said the existence of a supervisory board is one form of weakening of this anti-corruption institution.
KPK spokesman Febri Diansyah said there was no problem with the direct appointment of members of the Supervisory Board by President Joko Widodo or Jokowi. Because, he said, this was in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2019 concerning the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK Law).
"The problem is not the criteria, but there are some problems in the law that risk weakening," he said, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Febri said the KPK had analyzed the revised Act. The result was found there were 26 points of change that could potentially weaken the KPK. One of the things considered to weaken the KPK is the existence of the Supervisory Board itself.
The KPK transition team that conducted a review of the new law said the Supervisory Board was more powerful than the KPK leadership, but the requirements to become the KPK leadership were more severe than the Supervisory Board.
KPK leaders are required to have a legal degree or other degree with expertise and experience of at least 15 years in the fields of law, economics, finance or banking. There are no conditions for the supervisory board.
In addition, the authority of the board also falls on the technical handling of the case. They have the authority to give written permission for wiretapping, search and seizure.
The integrity of the Supervisory Board is also another thing that is highlighted by the transition team. Unlike the leadership of the KPK, members of the supervisory board are not prohibited from meeting with parties who are litigating at the KPK. This according to the team has the potential to cause conflicts of interest.
Febri said the KPK had no authority to determine the criteria and conditions for a supervisory board. Because these two things are already regulated by law. "What are the criteria, what are the conditions, the law has been regulated," said Febri.
